intro: Gomphandra polymorpha var. acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed gomphandra, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly in countries like India and Sri Lanka. This variant is distinguished by its acuminate (sharply pointed) leaf tips, which are a key identifying feature.
